page.title: 17A Day in the Life of a Child
page.content: Continued home for lunch and the rest of us have sandwiches. After the registers have been taken we have to push some of the desks back for the other children to come in for assembly. We sing a hymn and some of the children from the infants class show us their pictures they have drawn about their families. After the prayer the other children leave and we do mathematics until play. We play football with a small tennis ball and pretend we are playing for our favourite teams. Most of the boys support Liverpool. We do English up to lunch time, answering questions about houses from the past and putting some sentences into the past tense. We eat our lunch in our classroomand go out to play at about twelve thirty. We have to come in early to get
